title: User able to access company details in yrityspalvelu without proper permissions

profile.name: LocalTapiola
profile.about: LocalTapiola’s products and services cover non-life, life and pension insurance, as well as investment and saving services.

vulnerability_information:
## Basic report information
**Summary:** User able to access company details in yrityspalvelu without proper permissions

**Description:** User can access "any" company detail information, contracts, bills etc if able to do TUPAS authentication. If company already have "pääkäyttäjä" accounts made, this most like wont work. I tried with "clean/fresh" company.

**Domain:** https://yrityspalvelu.tapiola.fi/

## Browsers / Apps Verified In:

  * Chrome

## Steps To Reproduce:

 1. Go to https://yrityspalvelu.tapiola.fi/a3/YvpAuthWebKoha/verkkopalveluhakemus/
 2. Fill with company info you want examine (y-tunnus)
 3. Give any bogus user data
 4. Do TUPAS authentication and follow registration till end.
 5. Login using fresh credentials (email+passwd)
https://yrityspalvelu.tapiola.fi/a1/tatuma/jsp/kayttaja/kirjaudu.jsp
 6. View bills, company information, made insurance claims etc..

## Additional material

  * not this time.

## Related reports, best practices

*tick on "Minulla on lupa tehdä yrityksen verkkopalvelusopimus." should not be enough properly ensure user permission to view company information and in some cases quite sensitive one.
vulnerability_information_html:
Basic report information

Summary: User able to access company details in yrityspalvelu without proper permissions

Description: User can access "any" company detail information, contracts, bills etc if able to do TUPAS authentication. If company already have "pääkäyttäjä" accounts made, this most like wont work. I tried with "clean/fresh" company.

Domain: https://yrityspalvelu.tapiola.fi/

Browsers / Apps Verified In:

  • Chrome

Steps To Reproduce:

  1. Go to https://yrityspalvelu.tapiola.fi/a3/YvpAuthWebKoha/verkkopalveluhakemus/
  2. Fill with company info you want examine (y-tunnus)
  3. Give any bogus user data
  4. Do TUPAS authentication and follow registration till end.
  5. Login using fresh credentials (email+passwd) https://yrityspalvelu.tapiola.fi/a1/tatuma/jsp/kayttaja/kirjaudu.jsp
  6. View bills, company information, made insurance claims etc..

Additional material

  • not this time.

Related reports, best practices

*tick on "Minulla on lupa tehdä yrityksen verkkopalvelusopimus." should not be enough properly ensure user permission to view company information and in some cases quite sensitive one.

activities.message:
Some more info:
1. You can also change company information (IBAN, contact person, alter "toimiala" addr).
2. To login without tupas (after first tupas auth) you need to go to "käyttäjähallinta" and then send  "lähetä käyttäjätunnus".

activities.message:
We would like to thank you for bringing this issue to our attention. Our team has looked at the report and decided that this is either out of scope and/or has very small business impact. The report will be closed as informative, with no bounty and no disclosure.

This is based on a business decision and a taking a limited amount of risk to be able to have a smooth process. There are measures and manual checks to mitigate possible misuses.
activities.markdown_message:
We would like to thank you for bringing this issue to our attention. Our team has looked at the report and decided that this is either out of scope and/or has very small business impact. The report will be closed as informative, with no bounty and no disclosure.

This is based on a business decision and a taking a limited amount of risk to be able to have a smooth process. There are measures and manual checks to mitigate possible misuses.

activities.message:
Hello,

Few notes about the subject.

I do disagree with teams decision to leave e.g. peoples possible health and medical information to open. The data revealed by means is not limited to current time. User can fetch data from the past occurrences, as also the future ones if proper company account holder does not reclaim  admin rights via Localtapiola staff. It does seems that customers all insurance related incidents and documents related to company are open to view.

It is true that this directly posses small direct monetary business impact. This should be looked in the bigger picture and via rules and law directives which e.g. insurance companies should comply. I hope team have discussed how this goes along with papers given by 'Vakuutusyhtiöiden keskusliitto', several Finnish laws trying to clarify processing of data provided in the portal and GDPR.

At this time, it does sound very confusing Localtapiola is not going to do anything about this (even when you have this awesome program going on). I wonder, if this could be done in manner "uber-cool-31337-scripting with bling blings with highly technical notes could elevate the impact" -hopefully not. Person could over the weekend code and collect a lot of e.g. health information thru insurance claims made by or thru companies not yet using the web-service.

The thing is that i do care mostly of my insurance policies and personal information which Localtapiola posses. I do hope Localtapiola is handling this information in proper way - in my opinion it does not. The smooth process cannot be driver over the persons rights, laws to comply and privacy. In my opinion you are taking risk on peoples privacy.

//
activities.markdown_message:
Hello,

Few notes about the subject.

I do disagree with teams decision to leave e.g. peoples possible health and medical information to open. The data revealed by means is not limited to current time. User can fetch data from the past occurrences, as also the future ones if proper company account holder does not reclaim admin rights via Localtapiola staff. It does seems that customers all insurance related incidents and documents related to company are open to view.

It is true that this directly posses small direct monetary business impact. This should be looked in the bigger picture and via rules and law directives which e.g. insurance companies should comply. I hope team have discussed how this goes along with papers given by 'Vakuutusyhtiöiden keskusliitto', several Finnish laws trying to clarify processing of data provided in the portal and GDPR.

At this time, it does sound very confusing Localtapiola is not going to do anything about this (even when you have this awesome program going on). I wonder, if this could be done in manner "uber-cool-31337-scripting with bling blings with highly technical notes could elevate the impact" -hopefully not. Person could over the weekend code and collect a lot of e.g. health information thru insurance claims made by or thru companies not yet using the web-service.

The thing is that i do care mostly of my insurance policies and personal information which Localtapiola posses. I do hope Localtapiola is handling this information in proper way - in my opinion it does not. The smooth process cannot be driver over the persons rights, laws to comply and privacy. In my opinion you are taking risk on peoples privacy.

//

activities.message:
Good discussion.

It is a fact though, that accessing any information requires TUPAS. This in turn means that a) you will get caught when using your personal credentials  or b) you need to steal sombody else's credentials. The first option, a), is a very big deterrent. As far as b) goes, if you manage to steal TUPAS-credentials, there are "more interesting" things that can be done, and we feel that we are not a prime target for such a threat.

Also, as your report says "If company already have "pääkäyttäjä" accounts made, this most like wont work" - I think this makes this vulnerability in reality very unlikely exploitable in any real way.

What I am saying is that your points about laws and regulations are very much on target, on we of course never prioritize "a speedy process" over laws and regulations nor our customers data nor customer security. In our view though, this is not the case.

As usual, we appreciate your comments and they will be read a few times over and considered.

Thomas

Also, as your report says "If company already have "pääkäyttäjä" accounts made, this most like wont work" - I think this makes this vulnerability in reality very unlikely exploitable in any real way.

What I am saying is that your points about laws and regulations are very much on target, on we of course never prioritize "a speedy process" over laws and regulations nor our customers data nor customer security. In our view though, this is not the case.

As usual, we appreciate your comments and they will be read a few times over and considered.

Thomas

activities.message:
Hi,

Adding few more thoughts:

About Tupas and a). It does not really matter if the person misusing credentials get caught or not, the customer data is already lost and it can not be recovered or made private by any means. Let´s assume that your family members all personal information and medical history related to Localtapiola will be in PasteBin. Even if the person responsible is jailed, your family members personal and private information is openly available and we can only imagine the cost in the 30 years to come when everything is taken in to account e.g. when calculating your personal insurance policies or applying into job. The data is lost, is public and misusable forever. In my thoughts TUPAS-creds are not the "thing" here and you are right that if person have another TUPAs-creds, there will be very interesting targets too.

Having been watching the handling of personal data in "KANTA" or other in medical information systems(e.g. PEGASOS, APOTTI), access to even light personal data is heavily restricted and regulated. (It would be unheard of that a total outsider could see the data or medical records of any number of persons.) One might think it should (and is?) be as restricted in the insurance and insurance claim handling. You have the number of how many of your clients have enabled "pääkäyttäjä". I would estimate that we can get quite an amount of "free accounts" stolen with little programming and then could exploit all data retrievable in the accounts.  Maybe results could be data from some tens of thousands smaller companies and thousands to some tens of thousands personal data records including medical information?

As for b) someone stealing TUPAS-creds is another story is beside my point.

I am glad to continue this conversation if need be.

//

The data is lost, is public and misusable forever. In my thoughts TUPAS-creds are not the "thing" here and you are right that if person have another TUPAs-creds, there will be very interesting targets too.

Having been watching the handling of personal data in "KANTA" or other in medical information systems(e.g. PEGASOS, APOTTI), access to even light personal data is heavily restricted and regulated. (It would be unheard of that a total outsider could see the data or medical records of any number of persons.) One might think it should (and is?) be as restricted in the insurance and insurance claim handling. You have the number of how many of your clients have enabled "pääkäyttäjä". I would estimate that we can get quite an amount of "free accounts" stolen with little programming and then could exploit all data retrievable in the accounts. Maybe results could be data from some tens of thousands smaller companies and thousands to some tens of thousands personal data records including medical information?

As for b) someone stealing TUPAS-creds is another story is beside my point.

I am glad to continue this conversation if need be.

//

Hi Thomas,

Have you yet discussed this more at the advisory board?

//

activities.message: No we have not. Reopening to make sure we process this accordingly.
activities.markdown_message: No we have not. Reopening to make sure we process this accordingly.

activities.message:
Hi,

Thank you for taking this for re-evaluating, I do truly believe this have very high severity despite of manual "checks of possible misuse". Anyone is able to replay this and without any tech. background. If the conclusion is that if attacker have used TUPAS-creds (getting caught is big enough deterrence to not to do criminal activities) I believe i do a lot of bounty money to pay back as often best bugs/bounties do come after TUPAS-auth.

Hopefully you can introduce this other side of the subject and have a good conversation around the table. If the result is still the same, please convince people that "ticking box / i have right to do this" is not anything and should be fixed. If this bug will go wild and is misused, some people will lost they confidential data and localtapiola will most likely face major monetary losses via fines.

activities.message: The privacy team (& compliancy) has processed this report and found that it most definitely is not a correct implementation. There is currently no schedule for fixing this, however this is surely triaged.
activities.markdown_message: The privacy team (& compliancy) has processed this report and found that it most definitely is not a correct implementation. There is currently no schedule for fixing this, however this is surely triaged.

activities.message: We have decided to award you with a bounty. The bounty tries to take into consideration the fact that TUPAS does make the exploitability quite much harder, but we also want to make a point that we appreciate your upfront persistence and that you challenged our decision in a very sensible manner. There is no fix yet, but we wanted to make this bounty decision anyhow at this point.

There is no fix yet, but we wanted to make this bounty decision anyhow at this point.

I am excited to hear this is going to the right direction. Hopefully fix will be deployed in near future. Eager to see what the fix will be and how to exploit that..

summaries.content:
##Issue

The reporter found a way to circumvent the privilege system for the admin-user for a company account. Once circumvented, a user could gain access to critical information in the company account, including user data. The finding requires the use of TUPAS-authentication as an entry point which made exploitability harder. 

##Fix

No final fix yet. Process-level controls added.

##Reasoning

The implementation as such was based on a business decision which included proper risk assessment. Initially this report was dismissed based on the existing risk assessment. The reporter however showed exemplary persistence and did a very thorough rebuttal of the bug bounty team's conclusions and decisions. The issue was then escalated within LähiTapiola with the specific angle of privacy and potential information leak of privacy sensitive data. The original business decision was re-evaluated and it was found to be out of line in light of the upcoming regulatory changes. The bounty reflects both criticality and exploitability.
summaries.content_html:
Issue

The reporter found a way to circumvent the privilege system for the admin-user for a company account. Once circumvented, a user could gain access to critical information in the company account, including user data. The finding requires the use of TUPAS-authentication as an entry point which made exploitability harder.

Fix

No final fix yet. Process-level controls added.

Reasoning

The implementation as such was based on a business decision which included proper risk assessment. Initially this report was dismissed based on the existing risk assessment. The reporter however showed exemplary persistence and did a very thorough rebuttal of the bug bounty team's conclusions and decisions. The issue was then escalated within LähiTapiola with the specific angle of privacy and potential information leak of privacy sensitive data. The original business decision was re-evaluated and it was found to be out of line in light of the upcoming regulatory changes. The bounty reflects both criticality and exploitability.
